materials.raw_text: Bismuth (Bi): 258 g, Antimony (Sb): 121 g, Terbium (Tb): 159 g, Yttrium (Y): 236 g

sourcing.instructions: Bismuth: Chemical supply stores or online suppliers (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich). Antimony: Chemical supply stores or online suppliers (e.g., Alfa Aesar). Terbium: Rare earth metal suppliers (e.g., American Elements). Yttrium: Chemical supply stores or online suppliers (e.g., Strem Chemicals).

1. Measure out 258 g of bismuth using a precise scale. 2. Measure out 121 g of antimony. 3. Measure out 159 g of terbium. 4. Measure out 236 g of yttrium. 5. Combine all metals in a clean, dry crucible. 6. Mix thoroughly to ensure homogeneity. 7. Place the crucible in a fume hood to avoid inhalation of any fumes.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 258 g of bismuth using a precise scale. 2. Measure out 121 g of antimony. 3. Measure out 159 g of terbium. 4. Measure out 236 g of yttrium. 5. Combine all metals in a clean, dry crucible. 6. Mix thoroughly to ensure homogeneity. 7. Place the crucible in a fume hood to avoid inhalation of any fumes.

steps: 1. Preheat the furnace to 800°C. 2. Once the temperature is reached, place the crucible in the furnace. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat the furnace to 800°C. 2. Once the temperature is reached, place the crucible in the furnace. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not remove the crucible until it is at a safe handling temperature.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not remove the crucible until it is at a safe handling temperature.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified alloy from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface durability.
